result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffry S Walker

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on November 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:27 PM Defendant Jeffry S Walker in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Jeffry S Walker.  Prosecuting attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes that a plea questionnaire has been filed in this case and reviews the plea and offer. Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant. Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Count 2 is dismissed and read in. Attorney Kershek requests a sentencing hearing date in about 30 days. No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for sentencing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:57 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Jeffry S Walker in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Jeffry S Walker.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Kershek provides an update; he needs some additional time to resolve the matter and is requesting a new plea and sentencing date in about 2-3 weeks.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:39 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeffry S Walker in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Jeffry S Walker.  Atty. Kershek is asking for a plea and sentencing date as soon as possible with the court's calendar.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing on September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.

1:15 PM Defendant Jeffry S Walker in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Jeffry S Walker. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.
Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Request from Atty Kershek for BBH
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $1000.00

2:22 PM Defendant Jeffry S Walker not in court.   Atty. Kershek appearing in court in person.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe.  Atty. Kershek requests an adjournment and stay the capias.  Court issues capias.
Extradition: #3
Hearing on August 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

09:03 AM Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court.   Defendant Jeffry S Walker did not appear.   Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek updates the Court on the status of this case stating after the waiver, they are prepared to set this matter for resolution.  Attorney Kershek requests one additional adjournment so he may get in touch with the defendant again and have him appear for the waiver.  State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to revoke and forfeit any bail.  The Court will allow one additional adjournment to give the defendant the opportunity to appear and sets for a waiver of preliminary hearing.  Court ordered a warrant stayed until next court date.  Hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 3, 2022 at 08:15 am.

08:19 AM Defendant Jeffry S Walker in court by zoom video with attorney Mark Emil Kershek, in person.  Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek had informed the Court this matter is a waiver of preliminary hearing and the defendant was having car troubles and needed to appear by zoom today.  Due to the defendant having technical difficulties, the Court will adjourn.  Attorney Kershek further informs the Court that after the waiver, they will be prepared to set this for a plea and sentencing date to resolve the case in its entirety.  Court sets for a waiver of preliminary hearing and orders the defendant appear IN PERSON for the next date.  Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 08:15 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing. Filed by Atty kershek
appointing Attorney Mark Kershek
Preliminary hearing on August 1, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

01:56 PM Defendant Jeffry S Walker in court, in custody, with attorney  State Public Defender Law Intern.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:15 am.
